noun.description: A monoamine oxidase inhibitor synthesized from propargyl bromide and benzylmethylamine, (formerly) used to treat depression and hypertension; N-methyl-N-propargylbenzylamine, C₆H₅CH₂N(CH₃)CH₂C≡CH.

origin: 1960s; earliest use found in Current Therapeutic Research. From -pargyl + -ine.
